revised_title: On the Cause of Variability in Condensing Swarms of Meteorites
tldr: The author investigates the cause of variability in condensing swarms of meteorites and suggests that the variability is produced by the revolution of smaller swarms around the central swarm, with maximum luminosity occurring at periastron passages. This theory is tested using color observations and the question of irregularity in selected variables belonging to Group II.
